meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a sclerotium.
meanings.sent1: The sclerotial growth on the plant looked like a small, hard bump.
meanings.sent2: The farmer noticed the sclerotial patches on the soil, indicating fungal presence.
meanings.sent3: The sclerotial appearance of the rock made it seem like a tiny, tough fortress.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as sclerotial as the roots of an ancient tree, unyielding to any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The sclerotial texture of the cookie made it crunchy and satisfying to bite into.

meanings.sent1: The sclerotial structure of the mushroom made it resilient to harsh conditions.
meanings.sent2: The garden had a sclerotial infestation, causing concern for the plants' health.
meanings.sent3: The chef's soup had a surprising sclerotial twist, adding a unique earthy flavor.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a sclerotial foundation, standing strong through many storms.
meanings.sent5: The sclerotial nature of the material made it durable and long-lasting.
